name: PlanDefinition_Recommendation_A2
title: PlanDefinition - WHO ANC Guideline Recommendation A.2

fhir_comments:
if anaemia detected
    recommend 120 mg of elemental iron and 400 ug of folic acid, daily (Recommendation A.2.1)
action.title: Daily Iron (120mg) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Daily elemental iron should be increased to 120 mg until her Hb concentration rises to normal

fhir_comments:
<groupingBehavior value="visual-group"/>
		<selectionBehavior value="exactly-one"/>
    <dynamicValue>
        <path value="action.title"/>
        <expression>
            <language value="text/cql"/>
            <expression value="Get Summary"/>
        </expression>
    </dynamicValue>
		<dynamicValue>
        <path value="action.description"/>
        <expression>
            <language value="text/cql"/>
            <expression value="Get Detail"/>
        </expression>
    </dynamicValue>
    <dynamicValue>
        <path value="action.extension"/>
        <expression>
            <language value="text/cql"/>
            <expression value="Get Indicator"/>
        </expression>
    </dynamicValue>

action.title: Daily Folic Acid (400ug) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Daily folic acid should be increased to 400 ug (0.4 mg) until her Hb concentration rises to normal

fhir_comments:
else if population anaemia prevalence >= 40%
    recommend 60 mg of elemental iron and 400 ug of folic acid, daily (Recommendation A.2.1)
action.title: Daily Iron (60mg) and Folic Acid Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Due to population's high anaemia prevalence, daily dose of 60 mg of elemental iron is preferred over a lower dose

action.title: Daily Folic Acid (400ug) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Due to population's high anaemia prevalence, daily dose of 400 ug (0.4 mg) of folic acid is preferred over a lower dose

fhir_comments:
else if population anaemia prevalence < 20% or daily iron not acceptable due to side-effects
    recommend intermittent oral iron: 120 mg of oral iron, and 2.8 ug of folic acid, weekly (Recommendation A.2.2)
action.title: Weekly Iron (120mg) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Weekly elemental iron should be increased to 120 mg

expression.expression: ANCRecommendationA2."Treat for Low Anaemia Prevalence or Iron Side Effects"

action.title: Weekly Folic Acid (2800ug) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Weekly folic acid should be increased to 2800 ug (2.8 mg)

expression.expression: ANCRecommendationA2."Treat for Low Anaemia Prevalence or Iron Side Effects"

fhir_comments:
else
    recommend 30 to 60 mg of elemental iron and 400 ug of folic acid, daily (Recommendation A.2.1)
action.title: Daily Iron (30mg-60mg) and Folic Acid Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Daily elemental iron should be increased to between 30m and 60mg

action.title: Daily Folic Acid (400ug) Supplementation
action.textEquivalent: Due to population's high anaemia prevalence, daily dose of 400 ug (0.4 mg) of folic acid is preferred over a lower dose
